intro: Cruciata balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan cruciata, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cruciform (cross-shaped) flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Cruciata balcanica is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
